properties.name: online
properties.summary: Boolean indicating if the device is connected to the network.

properties.name: reason
properties.summary: Human-readable text describing the reason for the change.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

methods.name: addHTTPCookie
methods.summary: Adds a cookie to the HTTP client cookie store.
methods.description: On iOS, the cookie will override an existing cookie with the same name, domain and path, if any. The cookie's expiryDate property must be a date later than the creating date, otherwise the cookie will not persist in the cookie storage. On Android, any existing cookie with the same domain and name will be replaced with the new cookie. This is a bug in BasicCookieStore because based on RFC6265, an existing cookie can be evicted and replaced only when it has the same cookie-name, domain-value and path-value with the new cookie.

parameters.name: cookie
parameters.summary: The cookie to add

methods.name: addSystemCookie
methods.summary: Adds a cookie to the system cookie store.
methods.description: On Android, Titanium.UI.WebView uses the system cookie store. Any existing cookie with the same domain, path and name will be replaced with the new cookie.

parameters.name: cookie
parameters.summary: The cookie to add

parameters.name: serviceType
parameters.summary: Service to search for, must include the protocol type suffix (._tcp).

parameters.name: domain
parameters.summary: Bonjour service domain to conduct the search in.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.summary: A dictionary object of properties defined in Titanium.Network.BonjourBrowser.

parameters.name: name
parameters.summary: Name of the service. Must be a unique identifier for this service type and domain.

parameters.name: type
parameters.summary: Type of service. Must include the protocol identifier (._tcp).

parameters.name: domain
parameters.summary: Domain to publish the service in.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.summary: Dictionary object of properties defined in Titanium.Network.BonjourService.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.summary: Properties to set on a new object, including any defined by Titanium.Network.Cookie except those marked not-creation or read-only.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.summary: Properties to set on a new object, including any defined by Titanium.Network.HTTPClient except those marked not-creation or read-only.

methods.name: createTCPSocket
methods.summary: Legacy method to create and return an instance of Titanium.Network.TCPSocket.
methods.description: Note that TCPSocket is still used with the Bonjour services. For other uses, see Titanium.Network.Socket.TCP.

parameters.name: hostName
parameters.summary: Host name to connect to/listen on.

parameters.name: port
parameters.summary: Port for the socket.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.summary: Socket's mode; one of READ_MODE, WRITE_MODE, READ_WRITE_MODE.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.summary: Dictionary object with properties defined in Titanium.Network.TCPSocket.

methods.name: decodeURIComponent
methods.summary: Returns a decoded version of a URI encoded value.

parameters.name: value
parameters.summary: URI encoded input value to be decoded.

methods.name: encodeURIComponent
methods.summary: Returns a URI encoded version of the specified URI component.
methods.description:
On iOS, this also escapes the following characters, which are allowed in a URL but may not be allowed or desirable inside a path component:

!*'();:@+$,/?%#[]=&

parameters.name: value
parameters.summary: Input value to be encoded.

methods.name: getHTTPCookies
methods.summary: Gets all the cookies with the domain, path and name matched with the given values from the HTTP client cookie store.
methods.description: The domain matching and path matching follow RFC6265. If name is null, return all the cookies with the domain and path matched.

parameters.name: domain
parameters.summary: The domain of the cookie to get. It is case-insensitive.

parameters.name: path
parameters.summary: The path of the cookie to get. It is case-sensitive.

parameters.name: name
parameters.summary: The name of the cookie to get. It is case-sensitive.

methods.name: getHTTPCookiesForDomain
methods.summary: Gets all the cookies with the domain matched with the given values from the HTTP client cookie store.

parameters.name: domain
parameters.summary: The domain of the cookie to get. It is case-insensitive.

methods.name: getSystemCookies
methods.summary: Gets all the cookies with the domain, path and name matched with the given values from the system cookie store.
methods.description: On Android, Titanium.UI.WebView uses the system cookie store. The domain matching and path matching follow RFC6265. If name is null, return all the cookies with the domain and path matched. The returned cookies only have their name and value properties returned.

parameters.name: domain
parameters.summary: The domain of the cookie to get. It is case-insensitive.

parameters.name: path
parameters.summary: The path of the cookie to get. It is case-sensitive.

parameters.name: name
parameters.summary: The name of the cookie to get. It is case-sensitive.

methods.name: registerForPushNotifications
methods.summary: Registers for push notifications with the Apple Push Notification Service.
methods.description:
Call this method at application startup.

Before calling this method, the application needs to call the registerUserNotificationSettings method and pass it the notification types to use. Setting the notification types with this method will have no effect and throws a warning.

parameters.name: config
parameters.summary: Dictionary specifying push-notification related options.

methods.name: removeAllHTTPCookies
methods.summary: Removes all the cookies from the HTTP client cookie store.

methods.name: removeAllSystemCookies
methods.summary: Removes all the cookie from the system client cookie store.
methods.description: On Android, Titanium.UI.WebView uses the system cookie store.

methods.name: removeHTTPCookie
methods.summary: Removes the cookie with the domain, path and name exactly the same as the given values from the HTTP client cookie store.

parameters.name: domain
parameters.summary: The domain of the cookie to remove. It is case-insensitive.

parameters.name: path
parameters.summary: The path of the cookie to remove. It is case-sensitive.

parameters.name: name
parameters.summary: The name of the cookie to remove. It is case-sensitive.

methods.name: removeHTTPCookiesForDomain
methods.summary: Removes the cookies with the domain matched with the given values from the HTTP client cookie store.

parameters.name: domain
parameters.summary: The domain of the cookie to remove. It is case-insensitive.

methods.name: removeSystemCookie
methods.summary: Removes the cookie with the domain, path and name exactly the same as the given values from the system cookie store.
methods.description: On Android, Titanium.UI.WebView uses the system cookie store.

parameters.name: domain
parameters.summary: The domain of the cookie to remove. It is case-insensitive.

parameters.name: path
parameters.summary: The path of the cookie to remove. It is case-sensitive.

parameters.name: name
parameters.summary: The name of the cookie to remove. It is case-sensitive.

methods.name: unregisterForPushNotifications
methods.description:
Per Apple's documentation, it is rarely necessary to call this method. See: unregisterForRemoteNotifications in the UIApplication Class Reference

For example, calling this method would be required if a new version of your application no longer supports push notifications.

properties.name: allHTTPCookies
properties.summary: A list of all cookies in the cookie storage.

properties.name: networkTypeName
properties.summary: Network type as a String. Returns one of NONE, WIFI, LAN, MOBILE, or UNKNOWN.

properties.name: online
properties.summary: Boolean value indicating if the device is connected to the network.
properties.description:
The online property is true if the device has network access via WiFi, LAN, or mobile/cellular network.

Note that if the device is connected to a private network without Internet access, then this property will be true as well. This means you cannot assume the device has Internet access if it's connected to the network.

properties.name: remoteDeviceUUID
properties.summary: Remote device UUID if the device is registered with the Apple Push Notification Service, or null if it is not registered.

properties.name: remoteNotificationsEnabled
properties.summary: Indicates whether push notifications have been enabled using registerForPushNotifications.

properties.name: remoteNotificationTypes
properties.summary: Array of push notification type constants enabled for the application.

constants.name: INADDR_ANY
constants.summary: Special hostname value for listening sockets, representing all locally available network interfaces.

constants.name: NETWORK_LAN
constants.summary: A networkType value indicating that the device is communicating over a local-area network.
constants.description: This constant is also a possible value for the networkType property of the change event.

constants.name: NETWORK_MOBILE
constants.summary: A networkType value indicating that the device is communicating over a mobile network.
constants.description: This constant is also a possible value for the networkType property of the change event.

constants.name: NETWORK_NONE
constants.summary: A networkType value indicating that no network is available.
constants.description: This constant is also a possible value for the networkType property of the change event.

constants.name: NETWORK_UNKNOWN
constants.summary: A networkType value indicating that the current network type is unknown.
constants.description: This constant is also a possible value for the networkType property of the change event.

constants.name: NETWORK_WIFI
constants.summary: A networkType value indicating that the device is communicating over a WiFi network.
constants.description: This constant is also a possible value for the networkType property of the change event.

constants.name: NOTIFICATION_TYPE_ALERT
constants.summary: Constant value for an Alert style push notification.

constants.name: NOTIFICATION_TYPE_BADGE
constants.summary: Constant value for a Badge style push notification.

constants.name: NOTIFICATION_TYPE_NEWSSTAND
constants.summary: Constant value for a Newsstand style push notification. Only available on iOS5 and later

constants.name: NOTIFICATION_TYPE_SOUND
constants.summary: Constant value for a Sound style push notification.

constants.name: PROGRESS_UNKNOWN
constants.summary: Constant value specifying that the progress of a download can not be calculated.

constants.name: READ_MODE

deprecated.notes:
Used with the deprecated Titanium.Network.TCPSocket only.

See Titanium.Network.Socket for constants used with Titanium.Network.Socket.TCP sockets.

constants.summary: Constant value specifying read-only mode for sockets.

constants.name: READ_WRITE_MODE

deprecated.notes:
Used with the deprecated Titanium.Network.TCPSocket only.

See Titanium.Network.Socket for constants used with Titanium.Network.Socket.TCP sockets.

constants.summary: Constant value specifying read-write mode for sockets.

constants.name: SOCKET_LISTENING

deprecated.notes:
Used with the deprecated Titanium.Network.TCPSocket only.

See Titanium.Network.Socket for constants used with Titanium.Network.Socket.TCP sockets.

constants.summary: Constant value representing a socket in the LISTENING state.

constants.name: TLS_VERSION_1_0
constants.summary: Constant value specifying TLS version 1.0 for SSL.

constants.name: TLS_VERSION_1_1
constants.summary: Constant value specifying TLS version 1.1 for SSL.

constants.name: TLS_VERSION_1_2
constants.summary: Constant value specifying TLS version 1.2 for SSL.

constants.name: TLS_VERSION_1_3
constants.summary: Constant value specifying TLS version 1.3 for SSL.

constants.name: WRITE_MODE

deprecated.notes:
Used with the deprecated Titanium.Network.TCPSocket only.

See Titanium.Network.Socket for constants used with Titanium.Network.Socket.TCP sockets.

constants.summary: Constant value specifying write-only mode for sockets.
